pr_title: HBASE-23833. The relocated hadoop-thirdparty protobuf breaks HBase asyncwal

timeline.message:
Use Reflection to access shaded Hadoop protobuf classes.

(cherry picked from commit a321e536989083ca3620bf2c53f12c07740bf5b0)

timeline.bodyText: Smile. These gymastics need big comment here to explain magic going on here. Smile.
timeline.author: saintstack

timeline.bodyText: The builder is from HDFS. It is NOT a pb. It has pbs in it?
timeline.author: saintstack

timeline.bodyText: Is this ok? This presumes what pb is on the CLASSPATH? pb2.5?  Should it be the shaded hbase ByteString?
timeline.author: saintstack

replies.bodyText: Or this is just a default setting?
replies.author: saintstack

replies.bodyText: Seems like it should be hbase internal shaded ByteString, not this com.google one.
replies.author: saintstack

replies.bodyText: oh. i get it. This is the HDFS ByteString. The one that will be on the CP for all versions before HDFS3.3. Ok.
replies.author: saintstack

timeline.bodyText: This is printed out once on class loading? We can prettify later.
timeline.author: saintstack

timeline.bodyText: This a byte array copy? If we wanted to wrap w/o copy, could we do that?
timeline.author: saintstack

replies.bodyText: yeah i think that's possible. In fact, that was the case prior to HBASE-17908. Here the code simply do what was there after HBASE-17908. I can certain try do the zero copy thing too.
replies.author: jojochuang

timeline.bodyText: hmm... we can't set this till setter time I suppose? Could we do it at static class loading time?
timeline.author: saintstack

timeline.bodyText: Needs comment on what this is doing.
timeline.author: saintstack

timeline.message:
Update to improve the code:

1. Added license.
2. Added more comments.
3. Wrap byte array instead of copy to make a ByteString.
4. Moved all reflection instantiation to static class loading time.
Use LiteralByteString to wrap byte array instead of copying it.
